title: Ticket #1492: condor_qedit doesn't tell user about bad attribute values
description: When condor_qedit is given an invalid ClassAd value, the schedd rejects the change, but condor_qedit reports that the attribute was successfully modified.
remarks:
2010-Jul-09 10:47:12 by jfrey:
The schedd's SetAttribute() and SetAttributeByConstraint() call AttrList::IsValidAttrValue() early on to check the validity of the attribute value. This function only checks whether the value contains a newilne, which causes grief for the job queue log. Eventually, the attribute name and value are given to the the ClassAdCollection for the job queue. This doesn't check the validity of the value either. It writes it into the log, then attempts to insert it into the in-memory job ClassAd. The latter fails, but no clue of this is recorded anywhere.
creator: jfrey
